header.abstract: The University of Kentucky Women's Forum records (dated 1988-2020, undated; 6.7 cubic feet, 920.96 gigabytes; 18 boxes, 1 oversize folder, and 1970 digital files) comprise correspondence, bylaws, reports, spreadsheets, publications and newsletters, newspaper clippings, photographs, videocassettes, and audio documenting the establishment, the Board of Directors, committees, programs and events, and finances of this university organization dedicated to empowering and supporting women at the university.

descriptive_summary.author: Kaitlyn Bucholtz, Ruth E. Bryan, Josh May, Marie Dale
descriptive_summary.title: University of Kentucky Women's Forum records
descriptive_summary.source: University of Kentucky Women's Forum records
descriptive_summary.arrangement: Collection is arranged by subject into seven series: Board of Directors; Events; External Correspondence; Governing Documents and Women's Forum History; Marketing, Publicity, and Publications; Financial Documents; and Audiovisual. Thereunder, series are arranged alphabetically or chronologically.

descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2000ua020 : [identification of item], University of Kentucky Women's Forum records, 1988-2020, undated, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Established in 1991, the University of Kentucky's Women's Forum evolved from a University of Kentucky Women Administrators' group active from 1988-1990. The Women's Forum is open to all employees at the University of Kentucky and strives to empower, validate and celebrate the women working at the University. In 1992, the Women's Forum inaugurated the first UK Staff Appreciation Day, an event that is now organized by the university Staff Senate. The Forum began the Sarah Bennett Holmes Award and Award luncheon in 1994. This award celebrates the legacy of Sarah Bennett Holmes, a former Dean of Women at the University of Kentucky who spent her career empowering and promoting women while struggling against personal odds. The award recognizes female employees who are doing the same. From 1991-1996, The University of Kentucky Women's Forum also hosted many brown bag lunch programs, usually accompanied by a general members meeting. The Women's Forum continues to be an active University of Kentucky organization.
Sources: 1. University of Kentucky Women's Forum, https://www.uky.edu/womensforum/, accessed 12/5/2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The University of Kentucky Women's Forum records ((dated 1988-2020, undated; 6.7 cubic feet, 920.96 gigabytes; 18 boxes, 1 oversize folder, and 1970 digital files) comprise correspondence, bylaws, reports, spreadsheets, publications and newsletters, newspaper clippings, photographs, videocassettes, and audio documenting the establishment, the Board of Directors, committees, programs and events, and finances of this university organization dedicated to empowering and supporting women at the university. The collection includes Board of Directors meeting minutes, correspondence, and reports. Programs and events represented in the collection include UK Staff Appreciation Day, the Women's Forum retreat, the Sarah Bennett Holmes Award and Award luncheon, and brown bag lunch presentations, discussions, and general member meetings. Topics documented in the collection that the Women's Forum was concerned with include harassment, parenting and working, university benefits, and women's representation in the workplace. Women's Forum committees represented in the collection and dealing with these issues include the parenting and issues committees. Individuals found in the collection include Louise Stone, Marguerite Floyd, Randolph Hollingsworth, Susan Hodgetts Stempel and Mary Ida Gray. There are also records for the pre-Women's Forum group, University of Kentucky Women Administrators, 1988-1990. Because the Women's Forum had an archive committee from 2000-2001, the collection is relatively complete for the years 1992 to 2002. There are some records from 2002 to 2004. Post-2004 records primarily comprise Board of Directors agendas and meeting minutes, newsletters, and a Digital Guide.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing of this collection was supported by the University of Kentucky Women's Forum.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.

did.unittitle: Governing Documents and Women's Forum History
